title: Andrew R. Wheeler
added: In arguing in favor of the proposed rule, Wheeler called on the EPA to use the kind of [[Blinded experiment|double-blind]] studies the FDA uses. This assertion was criticized by the [[Union of Concerned Scientists]], which described Wheeler's comment as "breath-takingly ignorant" because double-blind studies ([[Clinical study design|study designs]] in which "both researchers and study subjects don't know which subjects are given the placebo versus the treatment") are possible in drug trials but are infeasible in most of the kind of research the EPA does, i.e. measuring environmental impact.<ref name="UCS">{{Cite web |date=2019-06-06 |title=Wheeler's Breathtaking Ignorance of Science, in One Comment |url=https://blog.ucsusa.org/gretchen-goldman/wheelers-breathtaking-ignorance-of-science-in-one-comment |access-date=2019-06-09 |publisher=Union of Concerned Scientists |language=en-US}}</ref>
